proverb_text: A Bow long bent at last waxes weak

references.author: Coverdale
references.text: The bowe will breake yf it be to sore bent.

references.author: I. Whitney
references.text: The bow that euer standeth bent too far wyll neuer cast The mind which euermore is slack, doth badly proue atlast.

references.author: Lyly
references.text: Is it not true which Seneca reporteth, that as to much bendinge breaketh the bowe, so to much remission spoyleth the minde?

references.author: Melbancke
references.text: Like a bowe longe bent that in proces weakens.

references.author: Dr.
references.text: A Bow too much bent will be broken.
